intro: Duvernoia potarensis, commonly known as the Potaro or Potaro tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of northern South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments and can grow up to 30 meters in height. Its bark is thick and fibrous, and it plays a role in the ecological systems of its native habitat. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
